content.raw: Looks good! Minor nitpick: Would it make sense to move the block with the “SkyX” string comparison after the “ignore transparent” block? I imagine the latter would be the faster operation and thus in cases where there are many transparent objects, a lot of string comparisons could be avoided.
content.html: Looks good! Minor nitpick: Would it make sense to move the block with the “SkyX” string comparison after the “ignore transparent” block? I imagine the latter would be the faster operation and thus in cases where there are many transparent objects, a lot of string comparisons could be avoided.

content.raw:
While making this change, I noticed that the clouds also have alpha rejection set. Apparently returning a null material in the original code wasn’t sufficient. 

I merged the two checks and verified that returning an empty material also works for the pine tree model.
content.html:
While making this change, I noticed that the clouds also have alpha rejection set. Apparently returning a null material in the original code wasn’t sufficient.

I merged the two checks and verified that returning an empty material also works for the pine tree model.
